sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The lover: or, Nuptiall love. VVritten, by Robert Crofts, to please himselfe R. C. (Robert Crofts) Marshall, William, fl. 1617-1650, engraver.
[96] p.
Printed by B. Alsop and T. F[awcet] for Rich: Meighen, next to the middle Temple in Fleet-street, London : 1638.
Fawcet's name from STC. Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: pi¹ A-F (F⁵ + [chi]¹) (-A1,F8). With an additional title page, engraved, "The lover or A discourse of nuptiall love", signed "W. Marshall, sculp:". Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[96] p.
Printed by B. Alsop and T. F[awcet] for Rich: Meighen, next to the middle Temple in Fleet-street, London : 1638.
Fawcet's name from STC. Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: pi¹ A-F (F⁵ + [chi]¹) (-A1,F8). With an additional title page, engraved, "The lover or A discourse of nuptiall love", signed "W. Marshall, sculp:". Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Rich: Meighen, next to the middle Temple
B. Alsop
T. F[awcet]
